schedule.notes: Identify overlapping subproblems and optimal substructure. Practice memoization and tabulation.

schedule.lp_focus: Invent and Simplify, Are Right, A Lot
schedule.notes: Recall situations where you innovated, simplified complex problems, or made sound judgments based on data and experience.
Deep dive: Design a Distributed Cache (e.g., Redis). Consider consistency, availability, partitioning, eviction policies.
Practice graph traversal algorithms. Understand adjacency list/matrix representations. Topological sort for dependencies.
Work on more complex DP problems. Focus on state definition and transition equations.
Understand the backtracking template: choose, explore, unchoose. Practice pruning the search space.

schedule.lp_focus: Learn and Be Curious, Hire and Develop the Best
schedule.notes: Reflect on how you've grown, learned new skills, and helped others develop. Emphasize continuous improvement.
Deep dive: Design a Chat System (e.g., WhatsApp). Consider real-time communication, message storage, scaling.

problems: Kth Largest Element in an Array (LC 215)
schedule.notes: Understand heap properties and operations. Use heaps for problems involving finding min/max k elements.

problems: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array (LC 153)
schedule.notes: Master binary search variants. Apply divide and conquer for problems that can be broken into smaller, independent subproblems.

problems: 0/1 Knapsack Problem (variant: LC 416 Partition Equal Subset Sum)
schedule.notes: Tackle challenging DP problems. Focus on optimizing space and time complexity.

schedule.lp_focus: Insist on the Highest Standards, Think Big, Bias for Action
schedule.notes: Discuss how you raised the bar for quality, envisioned ambitious solutions, and took calculated risks to achieve results.
Deep dive: Design a Recommendation System. Explore collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, data storage, and serving.
Understand shortest path algorithms and their applications. Review MST concepts.

problems: Add and Search Word - Data structure design (LC 211)
schedule.notes: Learn about Tries for efficient prefix searching. Practice using them for word-related problems.
Simulate a real coding interview. Focus on communication, problem-solving steps, and coding clean solutions. Get feedback.
Share examples of achieving results with limited resources, building strong relationships through reliability, and demonstrating attention to detail.
Deep dive: Design a Ride-Sharing App (e.g., Uber/Lyft). Focus on matching, real-time location, payment, notifications.

schedule.lp_focus: Customer Obsession, Ownership, Invent and Simplify
schedule.notes: Practice integrating LP answers with technical discussions. Refine your STAR stories.

problems: Problems from areas identified as weak during mock interviews or previous practice.
schedule.notes: Revisit challenging problems or topics. Explore segment trees, Fenwick trees (concepts) if time permits and relevant.

problems: Mix of frequently asked Amazon problems across categories
schedule.notes: Consolidate learning, focus on patterns and common interview problem types.
